list_definition.definition: a long loose piece of clothing which you wear before or after taking a bath or shower

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was wearing a cotton bathrobe.

list_ex_of_english: At home, he frequently wore a blue bathrobe, appearing in normal clothing only when needing to deal with officials or others outside his circle.
Cooperation with government and university institutions has allowed the weavers to create new items and designs including pants, bathrobes, skirts and more.

He was often seen wandering about the grounds and lobby in a tattered old bathrobe.
I understand the arguments about belt and braces but this measure adds a bathrobe and curtain, too.
